game_name: Case Files: The Death of Paulette Williams
game_description: Paulette Williams, age 62, has been killed. There are only two possible suspects. In this real-time, police interrogation simulator, you take on the role of the lead detective in the observation room. You must guide your partner to uncover the truth. Through the use of real-time suspect interviews, video playback, case files, and your own wits, you must make critical decisions that will shape the course of this investigation. Put your detective skills to work, as you attempt to seek justice and bring this case to a close.
review_1: I really enjoyed this game. I'm a sucker for detective games and incorporating FMV, so this really scratched an itch. The acting wasn't oscar-worthy, but nuanced enough to give you subtle clues about people's motives. The gameplay was pretty solid and enjoyable for about $10. My only complaint is there's not enough of it! There needs to be more cases and more suspects. It's a pretty straightforward game. I think my first playthrough took a little over an hour and it says I can play again and make different choices to affect the outcome! I'd love a game built on this engine with bonus cases as DLC, some with 4-5 suspects, and some with video testimony from medical examiners or forensic experts creating a Rashomon-like narrative.
